APK4903 - Basic Research Methods in Kine.name: APK4903 - Basic Research Methods in Kinesiology

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to Kinesiology B.S; STA 2023 and overall minimum 2.5 GPA or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An overview of the research process including evaluating research questions, analyzing data, and presenting findings.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Health Professions and Sciences

Department.title: Department
Department.text: School of Kinesiology and Physical Therapy– Kinesiology

APK4203 - Monitoring Training and Athlet.name: APK4203 - Monitoring Training and Athletic Performance

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to Kinesiology B.S and ZOO 3736C Exercise Physiology Anatomy or ZOO 3733C Human Anatomy; and minimum overall 2.5 GPA.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examination of how data collected on sport performance variables may improve the ability to successfully monitor athletes over a competitive season. Specific focus on which variables may be used as predictors of training status, athlete readiness and injury risk stratification.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Health Professions and Sciences

Department.title: Department
Department.text: School of Kinesiology and Physical Therapy– Kinesiology

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A review of principles of psychology related to the enhancement of satisfaction and performance in sports.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Triathlon concepts, training, and performance, leading to the development of optimal fitness and an improved healthy lifestyle.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Health Professions and Sciences

Department.title: Department
Department.text: School of Kinesiology and Physical Therapy– Kinesiology

APK2300 - Basic Sport First Aid and CPR.name: APK2300 - Basic Sport First Aid and CPR

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The prevention, identification, evaluation and care of athletic/sports injuries and other related topics. The introduction and instruction of basic life safety cardiopulmonary resuscitation and automated external defibrillator use for people working in athletics and sports settings.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Health Professions and Sciences

Department.title: Department
Department.text: School of Kinesiology and Physical Therapy– Kinesiology

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to Kinesiology B.S., Physical Education B.S., or Fitness Training Minor; minimum overall 2.5 GPA; PET 3351 Applied Exercise Physiology and ZOO 3736C or ZOO 3733C or equivalent.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Metabolic, neuromuscular, respiratory and cardiovascular physiological concepts and principles with practical application to kinesiology.

APK2160 - Facts and Fallacies in Exercis.name: APK2160 - Facts and Fallacies in Exercise and Nutrition

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Considerations for the appropriate interpretation of scientific and media-based content related to core concepts in nutrition and exercise.

Course Description.text: Field experience in a kinesiology organization, association, or business.
